recipes.name: Kacchi Biriyani
Ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into medium-sized pieces
recipes.procedure: Wash the rice in cold water and soak it for 30 minutes. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken with the marinade ingredients. Mix well and set aside for at least 2 hours, or overnight in the refrigerator. In a large pan, heat the ghee and oil over medium heat. Add the cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and bay leaves. Fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the sliced onions and fry until they turn golden brown. Add the chopped tomatoes and fry until the oil separates from the mixture. Add the marinated chicken and fry for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the cumin seeds, coriander seeds, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for another 5 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large pot, bring 8 cups of water to a boil. Add the soaked rice and cook until it is 70-80% done. Strain the rice and spread it out on top of the chicken in the pan. Do not mix. Sprinkle the rose water, saffron, fried onions, coriander leaves, and mint leaves over the rice. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes. Serve hot with raita or your favorite side dish. Enjoy your delicious Kachchi biryani!

recipes.name: Fish Curry
Ingredients: 500g firm white fish (such as cod or haddock), cut into medium-sized pieces
1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until they are soft. Add the fish pieces and coat them well with the spice mixture. Add the water and coconut milk and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or bread. Enjoy your delicious Fish Curry!

recipes.name: Haleem
Ingredients: 500g boneless mutton or beef, cut into small pieces
recipes.procedure: In a large pot, add the mutton or beef pieces, soaked wheat grains, and split yellow peas. Add enough water to cover the ingredients. Cook over medium heat for 1-2 hours, or until the meat is tender and the grains are soft and mushy. In a separate pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions and fry until they turn golden brown. Add the ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for another minute. Add the turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Mix well. Add the cooked meat and grain mixture to the pan with the fried onions and spices. Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Mix well. Cook over low heat for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is thick and has a porridge-like consistency. In a small pan, heat the ghee over low heat. Add the chopped coriander leaves, mint leaves, and fried onions. Fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the ghee mixture to the halim and mix well. Add the lemon juice and mix well. Serve hot, garnished with fried onions, fresh coriander leaves, fresh mint leaves, and chopped green chilies. Enjoy your delicious Halim!

recipes.name: Beef Curry
Ingredients: 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until they are soft. Add the beef pieces and coat them well with the spice mixture. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and tender. Stir in the yogurt and cook for another 5 minutes. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or bread. Enjoy your delicious Beef Curry!

recipes.name: Beef Kala Bhuna
Ingredients: 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until they are soft. Add the beef pieces and coat them well with the spice mixture. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and tender. Keep stirring occasionally. Increase the heat to high and fry the beef until it becomes dry and the oil starts to separate from the mixture. This should take around 10-15 minutes. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or bread. Enjoy your delicious Beef Kala Bhuna!

recipes.name: Sorisa Hilsha
Ingredients: 500g Hilsa fish, cut into medium-sized pieces
1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
2 tsp mustard seeds, ground into a paste
recipes.procedure: Rub the Hilsa fish pieces with 1 tsp of turmeric powder and salt. Set aside for 10 minutes. Heat the mustard oil in a pan over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the fish pieces and fry for a few minutes until they are golden brown. Remove the fish pieces from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the mustard seed paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and add the fried fish pieces to the pan. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice. Enjoy your delicious Sorisha Elish!

recipes.name: Prawn Malaikari
Ingredients: 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until they are soft. Add the prawns and coat them well with the spice mixture. Add the coconut milk and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the prawns are cooked through. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice. Enjoy your delicious Prawn Malaikari!

recipes.name: Beef Chui Jhal
Ingredients: 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Heat the mustard oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add the beef and coat it well with the spice mixture. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the curry has thickened. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice. Enjoy your spicy and flavorful Beef Chui Jhal!

recipes.name: Mutton Rezala
Ingredients: 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Heat the ghee or vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the mutton and coat it well with the spice mixture. Add the white pepper powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Reduce the heat to low and add the plain yogurt and milk. Mix well. Cover the pot and let the mutton cook on low heat for about an hour, stirring occasionally, until the meat is tender and the sauce has thickened. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or naan bread. Enjoy your creamy and aromatic Mutton Rezala!

recipes.name: Chicken Bhuna Khichuri
Ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into small pieces
1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Wash the rice and lentils together until the water runs clear. Soak them in water for 30 minutes. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn translucent. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add the chicken and coat it well with the spice mixture. Drain the rice and lentils and add them to the pot. Mix well. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot and let it simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the rice, lentils, and chicken are cooked and the khichuri has thickened to your desired consistency. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot. Enjoy your comforting and flavorful Chicken Khichuri!

recipes.name: Morog Polaw
Ingredients: 500g bone-in chicken, cut into small pieces
1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
recipes.procedure: Wash the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes. Heat the ghee or vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, cloves, bay leaf, cumin seeds, and coriander seeds and fry for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onions and fry until they turn golden brown. Add the garlic, ginger, and green chilies and fry for another minute. Add the chicken and coat it well with the spice mixture. Add the plain yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Drain the rice and add it to the pot. Mix well. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice and chicken are cooked and the water has been absorbed. Remove from heat and let it rest for 5-10 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious and aromatic Morog Polaw!

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken
recipes.procedure: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika, dried oregano, and lemon juice to make a marinade. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels and place it in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour the marinade over the chicken, seal the bag, and massage the chicken to coat it evenly with the marinade. Let the chicken marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes, or up to 8 hours for more flavor. Remove the chicken from the marinade and let any excess marinade drip off. Place the chicken on the grill and cook for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) and the juices run clear. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving. Enjoy your juicy and flavorful grilled chicken! You can serve it with your favorite sides, such as grilled vegetables or a salad.

recipes.name: Borhani
recipes.procedure: In a blender, combine the plain yogurt, water, roasted cumin powder, mint leaves, ginger paste, garlic paste, black salt, sugar, and salt. Blend the mixture until it becomes smooth and frothy. Taste the mixture and adjust the seasoning to your liking, adding more salt or sugar if needed. Pour the mixture into a large bowl or pitcher. Chill the Borhani in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve chilled in glasses, garnished with a few mint leaves if desired. Enjoy your refreshing and flavorful Borhani!

recipes.name: Roshmalai
recipes.procedure: In a large pot, bring the whole milk to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir occasionally to prevent the milk from burning. Once the milk comes to a boil, add the lemon juice and stir well. The milk will curdle and separate into solids and whey. Turn off the heat and strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth or a fine-mesh sieve. Rinse the curdled milk under cold running water to remove any lemony flavor. Squeeze out any excess water from the curdled milk and transfer it to a mixing bowl. Add the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and rose water to the mixing bowl. Mix well until it forms a smooth dough. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into small balls. Flatten them slightly with your palms. In a separate pot, add 2 cups of water and 1 cup of sugar. Stir well and bring it to a boil. Gently drop the Rasmalai balls into the boiling sugar syrup. Cover the pot and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the Rasmalai balls are cooked through and double in size. In another pot, bring the whole milk to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir occasionally to prevent the milk from burning. Add the sugar and cardamom powder to the milk. Stir well until the sugar dissolves. Once the Rasmalai balls are cooked, transfer them to the sweetened milk. Let them soak for at least 1 hour. Garnish the Rasmalai with chopped pistachios and saffron strands. Serve chilled and enjoy your delicious Rasmalai!

recipes.name: Panta Ilish
recipes.procedure: Wash the Ilish fish pieces thoroughly and rub them with salt. Set them aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine the leftover cooked rice with enough water to cover it completely. Let it soak for at least 4-5 hours or overnight. Drain the water from the soaked rice and mash it lightly with a fork or your hands. Add the yogurt and mix well. Add the finely chopped green chilies, onion, coriander leaves, and mint leaves to the rice mixture. Mix well. In a separate pot, add enough water to cover the fish pieces. Bring it to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the fish pieces and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through. Once the fish is cooked, remove it from the pot and let it cool slightly. Flake the fish into small pieces and add it to the rice mixture. Mix well. Add salt to taste and mix well. Cover the mixing bowl with a lid or plastic wrap and let it sit at room temperature for 8-10 hours or overnight. This will allow the mixture to ferment and develop a sour flavor. Once the mixture is fermented, give it a good stir and adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the Panta Ilish with lemon wedges and enjoy!

recipes.name: Shatkora Beef Curry
Ingredients: 1 lb beef, cut into small cubes
3-4 shatkora (available in South Asian grocery stores), cut into wedges
recipes.procedure: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan or pressure cooker over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add the minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for another 1-2 minutes. Add the cubed beef and mix well. Sauté for 5-6 minutes or until the beef is browned on all sides. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and sauté for another 2-3 minutes. Add enough water to cover the beef and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan or pressure cooker, and let it cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the beef is tender. If using a pressure cooker, cook for 10-12 minutes. Once the beef is tender, add the shatkora wedges to the pan. Add more water if needed to cover the shatkora. Cover the pan or pressure cooker and let it cook for another 10-12 minutes or until the shatkora is tender. Add salt to taste and mix well. If you prefer a thicker curry, you can mash some of the shatkora pieces with a spoon to thicken the gravy. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or naan. Enjoy the unique flavor of shatkora in this delicious beef curry!

recipes.name: Sylheti Akhni
Ingredients: 1/2 lb bone-in chicken, cut into small pieces
recipes.procedure: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in cold water for 30 minutes. Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add the ginger paste and garlic paste, and sauté for another 1-2 minutes. Add the chicken pieces and mix well. Sauté for 5-6 minutes or until the chicken is browned on all sides. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and sauté for another 2-3 minutes. Add 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Mix well and add salt to taste. Add the slit green chilies and mix well. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat for 10-12 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot. Enjoy this flavorful and hearty rice dish from Sylhet!

recipes.name: Jhal Muri
recipes.procedure: In a large mixing bowl, combine the puffed rice, chopped onion, chopped tomato, chopped cucumber, chopped cilantro, and chopped green chilies. Drizzle the mustard oil over the mixture and mix well. Add the tamarind pulp, chaat masala, roasted cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt to taste. Mix well. Serve the Jhalmuri in bowls or paper cones, garnished with lemon wedges. Enjoy this spicy and tangy snack that's perfect for any time of day!
